item.title: Runeshock Official - Passive Mode - Real Drops - Player Resting
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

Thread updated: X-logging whether against player or NPC will not sever your connection during combat. If you have passive mode disabled and X-logged, you will log on with passive mode still disabled. If you clicked the log-out button while passive mode is disabled, passive mode will be re-enabled by successful log out. Passive mode, and X-logging have been put into the complete section. Disabling passive mode gives you a white skull, and opens up an interface with, hp, prayer, energy, and a skull which you will not lose any items upon death. Attacking players will make that skull turn red and you will lose your items upon death.

Read full topic
item.source: Runeshock Official - Passive Mode - Real Drops - Player Resting
